_header: Saint Denis was in the old law pagan as other were
Subjects: saints’ lives; Denis, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Denis in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn denys was In þe olde lawe payn as oþer wereIn
                    þe cite of atteneis þer non oþer nere…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þer hi beȝut alle þre as monymen iseþGod
                    ȝeue ous part of þulke Ioie þat hi Inne beþ

Bod779.First Lines:
Sen denys In þe olde laue heþen as oþer wereIn
                    þe cyte of attenus þeras non oþer nere…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& bringe vs to þat ilke ioye þer þat hy
                    beþ inne& to oure kende eritage heuen blisse to winne

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
Seint Deonis was in þe olde lawe þaynym as oþere
                    wereIn þe Cite of Attenes þere none oþere
                    nere…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…þere beoþ ȝet alle þreo as men þere y
                    seoþGod geue vs part of þe ioye þat þei inne
                    beoþ
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayn dinyse was of paynyms law wele he knew þer loreWych in
                    þe cite of attenes als all oyer woreÞe best clerkes of þe
                    werld þat ilc tyme yore wereDynys was þat same tyme þer
                    maister þem to lere…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Þe sawles wyth myrth to heuen went þe bodise left
                    þer all threffor þeir loue god grant it vs in heuen wyth þem
                    to be

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein denis was in the olde lawe paynim as oþer wereIn þe
                    cite of attenis þare non oþer nere…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…þere hi beoþ ȝute alle þre as many men i
                    seoþGod ȝiue us part of þulke ioie þat hi Inne
                    beoþ
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 2.434-9.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Denys was in þe olde lawe paynym as oþere wereIn
                    þe Cite of Athenes þer none oþere men nere…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þer hi beoþ alle þreo as many man ȝut
                    yseoþGod ȝiue vs part of þat ioye þat hi ynne
                    beoþ

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Denys in þe old lawe was paynym as many wereIn þe
                    cite of attenys þer non oþer paynymes þer
                    nere…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þer beþ ȝut alle þre as many men hem
                    seþgod ȝyue ous parte of þe Ioie þat hii in
                    beþ

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEyn denys was in þe olde lawe paynym as oþer wereIn þe cite of attenes þer non oþer nere…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þer hi beþ ȝut alle þre as moni man iseþgod ȝif ous part of dilke ioie þat hi Inne beþ
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxvii” added to left margin by later hand (f. 147v).

BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þare hi beoþ ȝute alle þreo as manie men IseoþGod ȝiue us part of þulke ioie þat hi Inne beoþ

BLHar2277.First Lines: SEint Demis was in þe olde lawe payn as oþere wereIn þe Cite of Attenes þer non oþere nere…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Þer beoþ ȝute alle þreo as meni men iseoþGod gyue ous part of þulke ioye þat hi inne beoþ

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt denys in þe olde laws was payȝen as oþer wereIn þe cite of athenes þer non oþer nere…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …þere hii beþ ȝut alle þre as monte men yseþGod ȝif vs part of þulk ioiȝe þat hii inne beþ

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Denys in þe olde lawe was paynym as oþer mo wereIn
                    þe Cite of Athenes non þer þen siche þer
                    nere…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Þere þai be ȝett all þre as mony men
                    senGod ȝeue vs part of þat blis þat þai inne ben
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Denys in þe olde lawe was panyme as oþer wereIn
                    þe Cite of Athenys þer noon oþer ner…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þer þey ben alle þre as many men seeþGod
                    sende vs grace of þat Ioye þat þei in beþe
